motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • April 29, 2024 meeting minutes • Intergovernmental agreement with City of Peachtree Corners for Winters Chapel Path Phase 2 Project

motions.title: Contract with TSW for Comprehensive Plan and Unified Development Code
motions.description: Award contract to TSW for Comprehensive Plan and Unified Development Code in amount of $499,990, subject to final legal review.

motions.title: RZ 23-03 Rezoning Approval (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of RZ 23-03 for 245 Perimeter Center Parkway to amend zoning conditions for mixed use project including office, hotel, multifamily residential with retail and restaurant space.

motions.title: Public Safety Ambassadors Personnel Request
motions.description: Approval of additional personnel request for Public Safety Ambassadors with adjusted salary grade to Grade 104.

motions.title: Contract for Phase II Vermack Path at Dunwoody High School
motions.description: Award contract to Sol Construction, LLC for $108,251 plus 10% contingency for Phase II of Vermack Road path, plus funding authorization for stormwater improvements up to $296,015 plus 20% contingency.

motions.title: Postpone Lighting Services Agreement with Georgia Power
motions.description: Motion to postpone approval of lighting services agreement with Georgia Power for Vermack path to May 28, 2024 meeting.

motions.title: SS4A Implementation Grant Application for North Peachtree Road
motions.description: Approval of Safe Streets and Roads For All (SS4A) implementation grant application for North Peachtree Road project ($19.75M total, $15.8M federal share, $3.95M city match).

specialEvents.title: Citizens' Police Academy Class XIV Graduation
specialEvents.description: Recognition of Citizens' Police Academy Class XIV graduates, with Officer Hernandez presenting the program.

specialEvents.title: Administration of Oath of Office - Officer Alvin Slocum
specialEvents.description: Mayor Deutsch administered oath of office to Officer Alvin Slocum.
